name: joules
description: The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: kilojoules
description: The kilojoule is a thousand joules. The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: megajoules
description: The megajoule is a million joules. The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: gigajoules
description: The gigajoule is a billion joules. The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: terajoules
description: The terajoule is a thousand billion joules. The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: petajoules
description: The petajoule is a million billion joules. The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: exajoules
description: The exajoule is a billion billion joules. The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: tonnes of oil equivalent
description: A tonne of oil equivalent is the energy content of a very specific tonne of oil. It is not the energy content of any particular tonne of oil. It is used by the IEA statistics and the UK Digest of Energy Statistics when counting overall demands and supplies for all types of energy.

name: thousands of tonnes of oil equivalent
description: A thousand tonnes of oil equivalent is the energy content of a very specific thousand tonnes of oil. It is not the energy content of any particular tonne of oil. It is used by the IEA statistics and the UK Digest of Energy Statistics when counting overall demands and supplies for all types of energy.

name: millions of tonnes of oil equivalent
description: A million tonnes of oil equivalent is the energy content of a very specific million tonnes of oil. It is not the energy content of any particular tonne of oil. It is used by the IEA statistics and the UK Digest of Energy Statistics when counting overall demands and supplies for all types of energy.

name: square metres
aliases: square meter, meter2, metre squared, meter squared
description: A <b>square metre<b> is the SI standard measure of area. It is used by scientists.

name: million hectares
description: A million hectares is a metric measure of area. It is used when referring to country sized areas of land.

name: hectares
description: A hectare is a metric measure of area. It is used when referring to areas of land.

name: ares
description: The are is a metric unit of area, equal to 100 square meters, used for measuring land area. It was defined by older forms of the metric system, but is now outside of the modern International System (SI). It is commonly used to measure real estate, in particular in Indonesia and in French-, Portuguese-, Slovakian-, Czech-, Polish-, Dutch-, and German-speaking countries and also in India. Sotka is the Russian name. Source: Wikipedia.

name: petagrams of carbon
description: The traditional measure of greenhouse gas quantity, when considered at a global scale

name: grams of carbon
description: The fundamental unit of measure of greenhouse gas quantity, but too small for practical use.

name: grams of carbon dioxide equivalent
description: A measure of greenhouse gas quantity. There is some debate about the right factor to use when converting to this value from other greenhouse gases (e.g., methane).

name: kilograms of carbon dioxide equivalent
description: A measure of greenhouse gas quantity. There is some debate about the right factor to use when converting to this value from other greenhouse gases (e.g., methane).

name: tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent
description: A measure of greenhouse gas quantity. There is some debate about the right factor to use when converting to this value from other greenhouse gases (e.g., methane).

name: thousand tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent
description: A measure of greenhouse gas quantity. There is some debate about the right factor to use when converting to this value from other greenhouse gases (e.g., methane).

name: megatonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent
description: A measure of greenhouse gas quantity. Useful for representing a country's emissions. There is some debate about the right factor to use when converting to this value from other greenhouse gases (e.g., methane).

name: gigatonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent
description: A measure of greenhouse gas quantity. Useful for representing the world's emissions. There is some debate about the right factor to use when converting to this value from other greenhouse gases (e.g., methane).

name: watt-hours
description: A watt-hour is the energy emitted by running something with 1 watt of power for 1 hour.

name: kilowatt-hours
description: Kilowatt-hours are the unit used by electricity companies when reporting how much electricity a house has used. It is a thousand watt-hours.

name: megawatt-hours
description: Megawatt-hours are thousands of kilowatt-hours, which are the unit you see on your electricity bill. This unit is typically used for total electricity consumed by a factory over a year.

name: gigawatt-hours
description: Gigawatt-hours are millions of kilowatt-hours, which are the unit you see on your electricity bill. This unit is typically used for total electricity consumed or produced by a power station.

name: terawatt-hours
description: Terawatt-hours are billions of kilowatt-hours, which are the unit you see on your electricity bill. This unit is typically used for total electricity consumed or produced at a National level.

name: therms
description: The Therm is an archaic British measure of energy. Equal to 100 000 BTUs.

name: British thermal units
description: The British Thermal Unit is an archaic British measure of energy.

name: quads
description: The Quad is a thousand trillion british thermal units (1015). It is used by the US Department of Energy.

name: watts
description: A watt is the SI standard measure of power. It is a joule per second. It is used by scientists. It is a light-bulb sized amount of power.

name: kilowatt
description: A kilowatt is a thousand watts. It is a kilojoule per second. It is widely used. It is a kettle sized amount of power.

name: megawatt
description: A megawatt is a million watts. It is a megajoule per second. It is widely used. It is a train engine sized amount of power.

name: gigawatt
description: A gigawatt is a billion watts. It is a gigajoule per second. It is widely used. It is a power station or city sized amount of power.

name: terawatt
description: A terawatt is a trillion watts. It is a terajoule per second. It is widely used. It is a continental sized amount of power.

name: petawatt
description: A petawatt is a thousand trillion watts. It is a petajoule per second. It is widely used. It is a planetary sized amount of power.

name: ergs per second
description: An erg per second is ?

name: horsepower
description: A horsepower is a measure of power. Its value varies, but we assume here that it is the UK horsepower that is being used. It is rarely used now, even for car engine power.

name: watt-hours per year
description: A watt-hour per year is a measure of power. It is rarely used. But it gives a sense of the energy output from running a particular amount of power for a year.

name: kilowatt-hours per year
description: A kilowatt-hour per year is a measure of power. It is rarely used. But it gives a sense of the energy output from running a particular amount of power for a year.

name: megawatt-hours per year
description: A megawatt-hour per year is a measure of power. It is rarely used. But it gives a sense of the energy output from running a particular amount of power for a year.

name: gigawatt-hours per year
description: A gigawatt-hour per year is a measure of power. It is rarely used. But it gives a sense of the energy output from running a particular amount of power for a year.

name: terawatt-hours per year
description: A terawatt-hour per year is a measure of power. It is used in UK renewable energy accounting. It gives a sense of the energy output from running a particular amount of power for a year.

name: kilocalories
description: This is a food calorie, which confusingly is 1000× the thermal calorie and is therefore officially known as the kilocalorie. It is approximately the energy required to raise the temperature of 1 kg of water by 1 degree Celsius.

name: calories
description: This is the chemical calorie. If you see it in relation to food, then it is probably being used as shorthand for the kilocalorie which is 1000× larger. Please be careful to make sure you are using the right unit here.

name: ergs
description: The erg is a very small unit of energy. It isn't used much.

name: tons of TNT
description: The ton of TNT is a popular way of suggesting something is a lot of energy.

name: homes
description: The home is a popular way of suggesting something is a lot of energy. Unfortunately it is really imprecise. Normally it refers to the electricity consumed by a typical home (that is what we have assumed here) but it could refer to the gas used (which could be triple the electricity) or the total energy (which could be quadruple). In reality homes vary a lot.

name: thousand homes
description: The home is a popular way of suggesting something is a lot of energy. Unfortunately it is really imprecise. Normally it refers to the electricity consumed by a typical home (that is what we have assumed here) but it could refer to the gas used (which could be triple the electricity) or the total energy (which could be quadruple). In reality homes vary a lot.

name: million homes
description: The home is a popular way of suggesting something is a lot of energy. Unfortunately it is really imprecise. Normally it refers to the electricity consumed by a typical home (that is what we have assumed here) but it could refer to the gas used (which could be triple the electricity) or the total energy (which could be quadruple). In reality homes vary a lot.

name: Wales
aliases: waleses, the size of wales, the area of wales, waless
description: The Wales is a popular British way of suggesting that something covers a larger area. It is pretty precise, so not as bad as the home as a unit of energy.

name: square miles
description: The square mile is the imperial measure of area.

name: kilowatt-hours per day per person
aliases: kWh/p/d, kilowatt-hours per person per day
description: The kilowatt-hour per person per day is a unit for British energy supply and demand, popularised by David Mackay in his book Sustainable Energy Without the Hot Air. Because the number of people in the UK changes, this value will change over time. It uses the 2012 UK ONS population estimate.

name: gigawatt-hours per day
description: The gigawatt-hour per day is a unit used in the National Grid future energy scenarios when talking about the different levels of heating demand.

name: million standard cubic meters of gas per day
description: Millions of standard cubic meters per day is the unit the National Grid use to report flows of natural gas through the UK gas grid.

name: million standard cubic meters of gas
description: Millions of standard cubic meters per day is the unit the National Grid use to report flows of natural gas through the UK gas grid. The energy content varies by +/- 10% or so.

name: billion standard cubic meters of gas
description: Billions of standard cubic meters of natural gas is used when discussing gas demand at a European level.

name: barrel of oil equivalent
description: The barrel of oil equivalent is usually used for crude oil or for oil and gas together. Its energy content varies based on where the oil is from, so the conversion is approximate. This one is from BP. The "equivalent" means that this boe is usually using the ratio of six Mscf of natural gas to one barrel of crude oil, condensate or natural gas liquids, but BP uses 5.8 Mscf (not 6 Mscf) to be 1 boe.

name: kilogram of hydrogen
description: The kilogram of hydrogen appears to be used when specifying electrolysers.

name: kilogram of hydrogen per day
description: The kilogram of hydrogen per day appears to be used when specifying electrolysers.

name: cubic foot of natural gas
description: The <b>cubic foot<b> of natural gas is used in the USA . Its energy content varies. This conversion has taken the 2013 US average energy content.

name: hundred cubic feet of natural gas
description: In the USA, natural gas is sometimes measured in hundreds of cubic feet. The actual energy content of this gas can vary. In this conversion we have taken the 2013 average for the USA.

name: thousand cubic feet of natural gas
description: In the USA, natural gas is sometimes measured in millions of cubic feet. The actual energy content of this gas can vary. In this conversion we have taken the 2013 average for the USA.

name: million cubic feet of natural gas
description: In the USA, natural gas is sometimes measured in millions of cubic feet. The actual energy content of this gas can vary. In this conversion we have taken the 2013 average for the USA.

name: trillion cubic feet of natural gas
description: In the USA, natural gas is sometimes measured in trillions of cubic feet. The actual energy content of this gas can vary. In this conversion we have taken the 2013 average for the USA.

name: thousand Btu
description: In the USA, heating for a house is sometimes measured in thousands of Btu .

name: million Btu
description: In the USA, the price of natural gas is often quoted per million Btu as this normalises the effect of different types of gas having different calorific values.

name: standard cubic foot of natural gas
aliases: standard cubic feet of natural gas
description: The <b>cubic foot<b> of natural gas is used in the USA . Its energy content varies. This conversion has taken the 2013 US average energy content.

name: hundred standard cubic feet of natural gas
description: In the USA, natural gas is sometimes measured in hundreds of cubic feet. The actual energy content of this gas can vary. In this conversion we have taken the 2013 average for the USA.

name: million standard cubic feet of natural gas
description: In the USA, natural gas is sometimes measured in millions of cubic feet. The actual energy content of this gas can vary. In this conversion we have taken the 2013 average for the USA.

name: trillion standard cubic feet of natural gas
description: In the USA, natural gas is sometimes measured in trillions of cubic feet. The actual energy content of this gas can vary. In this conversion we have taken the 2013 average for the USA.

name: million Btu per hour
description: In the USA, the maximum heating rate for a house is sometimes measured in millionBtu per hour

name: million Btu per day
description: In the USA, the heating requirement for a house is sometimes measured in million Btu per day

name: billion of cubic feet equivalent of natural gas
description: In the USA, a term used in the natural gas industry to measure the size of a reserve, or a quantity delivered over years. The "equivalent" means that this boe is using the ratio of six Mscf of natural gas to one barrel of crude oil, condensate or natural gas liquids. (BP uses 5.8 Mscf not 6 Mscf to be 1 boe.)

name: tons of LNG
description: In the USA, liquefied natural gas (LNG) supplied in tankers is measured in thousands of tons.

name: tonnes of LNG
description: Liquefied natural gas (LNG) supplied in tankers is measured in thousands of tonnes.

name: ton
description: In the USA, the imperial ton is used (not the british ton)

name: tonne
description: The metric tonne is 1000 kg

name: million tonnes
description: A million metric tonnes is a unit of mass, which may be used for CO2 or oil or other fuel.

name: kilogram of LNG
description: The energy in a kilogram of LNG is the same as in a kilogram of natural gas (higher heating value)

name: dekatherm
description: Ten therms: a therm is an archaic unit of heat, and a dekatherm is one million Btu (MMBtu)

name: million barrels of oil per day
description: The oil output of a field or nation is expressed in million barrels of oil per day

name: barrel of oil per day
description: The oil output of an oilfield is expressed in barrels of oil per day

name: barrel of oil
description: A standard barrel of oil is 42 US gallons or 159 litres.

name: kilogram
description: a kilogram is a unit of mass equal to 1000 grams.
